c74object.name: cage.closer
c74object.digest: Modify pitch octave to approach a given pitch
c74object.description: Makes pitches closer to a given pitch, preserving their pitch-class (i.e. changing their octave).

outlet.description: The modified llll of cents of the notes, so that each note maintains its pitch-class, but is as close as possible to the reference pitch.

objarg.name: reference_pitch
objarg.description: The optional argument sets the initial reference pitch in midicents (also see number message).

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the result obtained from the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set pitches or reference pitch, output result
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet contains the pitches (as midicents) to be modified. The octave modification is performed (see below), and the result is output.
An llll in the second inlet is considered as a single number, being the reference pitch. All pitches of the llll in the first inlet will have their octave modified so that their distance to the reference pitch is minimal.

method.name: number
method.description: A number in the second inlet is the reference pitch. All pitches coming in the first inlet will have their octave modified so that their distance to the reference pitch is minimal.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Modified cents. The modified llll of cents of the notes, so that each note maintains its pitch-class, but is as close as possible to the reference pitch.
